import numpy as np # linear algebra

import os

    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.02e3dfc7:
mosub_subset = ['Name', 'Age', 'Wage','International Reputation','Height', 'Weight', 'Jersey Number', 'Strength', 'Positioning', 'Club', 'Nationality']
df_mosub = df_sub.loc[:,mosub_subset]
df_mosub.info()
source.3a8e3c55:
na_counts = df_mosub.isna().sum()[3:]
sb.barplot(na_counts.index.values, na_counts)

# get the current tick locations and labels
plt.xticks(rotation=90) 

# Logic to print value on each bar
for i in range (na_counts.shape[0]):
    count = na_counts[i]

    # Refer here for details of the text() - https://matplotlib.org/3.1.1/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.text.html
    plt.text(i, count+10, count, ha = 'center', va='top')
source.e20ecc7a:
df_mosub.Wage = df_mosub.Wage.apply(lambda x: converter(x))
df_mosub.Height = df_mosub.Height.apply(lambda x: convert_height(x))
df_mosub.Weight = df_mosub.Weight.apply(lambda x: int(int(x[:-3])/2.205))
df_mosub['Jersey Number'] = df_mosub['Jersey Number'].astype('int').astype("str")
source.767fe6fd:
bins = 10 **np.arange(3, 5, 0.1)
plt.hist(data= df_mosub, x='Wage', bins= bins)
plt.xscale('log')
ticks = [1000,2000,5000,10000,20000,50000,10000,200000,500000]
labels = ['1k','2k','5k','10k','20k','50k','100k','200k','500k']
plt.xticks(ticks, labels);
source.cda184af:
bins = np.arange(16,45+1,1)
plt.hist(data= df_mosub, x='Age', bins = bins)
plt.xlabel("Age (years)")
plt.axvline(df_mosub.Age.mean(), color='red')
plt.axvline(21, color='yellow');
source.4b7bb840:
wage_by_country = df_mosub.groupby('Nationality')['Wage'].mean().reset_index()
fig = px.choropleth(wage_by_country, 
                    locations= 'Nationality',
                    color= 'Wage',
                    color_continuous_scale='Reds',
                    locationmode="country names",
                    title= "Density of Borrower in each state")
fig.show()

fig = px.choropleth(wage_by_country, 
                    locations= 'Nationality',

                    color_continuous_scale='Reds',
                    locationmode="country names",
                    title= "Density of Borrower in each state")
fig.show()
source.8705b5dc:
base_color = sb.color_palette()[0]
df_sub = df_mosub.groupby("Jersey Number")['Wage'].mean().sort_values(ascending=False)[:10].reset_index()
sb.barplot(data=df_sub, x='Jersey Number', y='Wage',color=base_color)
plt.title("Average Salary for Top 10 Jersey");
source.fd1edf57:
g = sb.FacetGrid(data = df_mosub, hue = 'International Reputation', height= 5,
                 palette = 'mako_r')
g.map(plt.scatter, 'Age', 'Wage')
plt.ylabel("Wage ($)")
plt.title("Age and Wage relationship with International Reputation")
g.add_legend();
source.d89c0772:
g = sb.FacetGrid(data = df_mosub, hue = 'International Reputation', height= 5,
                 palette = 'mako_r')
g.map(plt.scatter, 'Height', 'Weight')
plt.ylabel("Wage ($)")
plt.title("Height, Weight relationship with International Reputation")
g.add_legend();
source.08cc5c27:
wage_by_country = df_mosub.groupby(["Nationality",'International Reputation']).mean().reset_index()
fig = px.choropleth(wage_by_country, 
                    locations= 'Nationality',
                    color= 'Wage',
                    color_continuous_scale='Reds',
                    locationmode="country names",
                    animation_frame= "International Reputation",
                    title= "Average Wage relation with popularity for each Country")
fig.show()
